lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The apartment door slams shut behind Carl.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The suburban street stretches out in both directions. Quiet. Normal.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Fresh air. Finally.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Okay. I just need to get to the car and drive far, far away.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl! Wait up, buddy!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: PAUL?! Why are you following me?!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: We're roommates, Carl. We go places together.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Besides, I need to pick up a few things from the neighbors.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: What THINGS, Paul?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh, you know. Neighborly stuff!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The parking lot should be at the end of the street.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I just need to walk past a few houses. Simple.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Nothing about today has been simple.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A middle-aged woman stands at the edge of her yard, arms crossed.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: Well, well. If it isn't the llamas from 42B.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Mrs. Henderson! Good morning!

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: Don't you 'good morning' me.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: What was all that noise last night? Sounded like someone was being murdered.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: We were rearranging furniture!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul, don't--

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Very heavy furniture. With lots of... fluid inside it.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: Fluid.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Waterbeds! We got waterbeds. Very sloshy.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: We should really keep moving.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Something is wrong with the Henderson yard.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The garden gnomes are arranged in a circle. Facing inward.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul... did you do something to Mrs. Henderson's garden gnomes?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh THOSE. I made a little art installation last Tuesday.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: An art installation.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Yep! I call it 'The Summoning Circle of Gerald.'

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Who is Gerald?!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh, Gerald was the neighbor two doors down.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Was.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: WAS?!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: He moved! To a farm! Upstate!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: One of the gnomes has red paint on its hands. At least, it looks like paint.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A narrow alley runs between two houses.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Trash cans are overturned. Something has been dragged through here.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: We could cut through the alley to save time.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh, I wouldn't go that way.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: No reason! Just... the feng shui is all wrong back there.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul, is there something in the alley?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Define 'something.'

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Something that used to be alive.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Define 'alive.'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A row of mailboxes lines the sidewalk.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: One of them is dripping.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Is that mailbox... leaking?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I sent Mrs. Patterson a gift!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: What kind of gift LEAKS, Paul?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Homemade jam! Remember my jam?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I am NEVER going to stop being suspicious of your jam.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A fly buzzes lazily around the mailbox slot.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Then another. Then a dozen.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A telephone pole is covered in MISSING PET flyers.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: There must be thirty of them. All from the last two weeks.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul... why are there so many missing pets in this neighborhood?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: It's migration season!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Cats don't migrate, Paul.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Not with that attitude they don't!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Please tell me you didn't eat anyone's cat.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl! I would NEVER eat a cat.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: They're terrible with rosemary.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: PAUL!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A lawn sprinkler sputters to life on the next yard over.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The water is pink.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Is that sprinkler spraying... PINK water?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh, that must be the new mineral water system I installed for the Johnsons.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You installed a sprinkler system for the neighbors.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Community service! Very important for property values.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: What minerals turn water PINK, Paul?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Iron! Perfectly natural.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The grass where the sprinkler hits has died in a perfect circle.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The parking lot comes into view. Almost there.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Finally! The car. We can just drive away from all this.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh, about the car...

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: What about the car, Paul?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I may have used the trunk for a little project last night.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You... WHAT?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: It's fine! I cleaned most of it.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: MOST of it?!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The important thing is we have a full tank of gas!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Something thumps in the trunk.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul. Did the trunk just move?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The shocks on this car are terrible.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: We're going downtown. We're going to the police.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh, that sounds like a GREAT idea!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Paul's enthusiasm is deeply concerning.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A crumpled MISSING poster. The photo shows a golden retriever named 'Biscuit.'

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Last seen Tuesday... three blocks from our apartment.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Oh no. Paul made 'biscuits' on Wednesday.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: MISSING: Biscuit. Golden Retriever, 4 years old. Very friendly.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The phone number at the bottom has been torn off.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I really hope this is a coincidence.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A pet collar, half-buried in a flower bed. The tag reads 'Mr. Whiskers.'

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: This is from the missing poster two blocks back.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Why is it HERE? In PAUL'S flower bed?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A small blue collar with a bell. The tag reads 'Mr. Whiskers - If found, call 555-0147.'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The collar has been cleanly cut. Not torn. Cut.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A handwritten recipe card, dropped on the sidewalk.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: That's Paul's handwriting.

lines.speaker: note
lines.text: 'Step 1: Acquire fresh ingredients (check yard). Step 2: Remove the...'

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I can't read the rest. I don't WANT to read the rest.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A recipe card in Paul's meticulous handwriting.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The ingredients list contains nothing you'd find at a grocery store.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Step 7 is circled twice: 'Dispose of leftovers in Mrs. Henderson's compost.'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A shovel, leaning against the fence. The blade is caked with fresh dirt.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Why is there a shovel out here? We don't have a garden.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: And why is the dirt so... dark?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A sturdy shovel. Recently used. The dirt on the blade smells of iron and something else.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: There's a strand of something caught in the handle. Hair, maybe.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Great day for a walk, isn't it, Carl?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul, we need to talk about what's happening.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Happening? Just two llamas enjoying the neighborhood!

options.text: What did you do to the neighbors?
What's in the trunk of the car?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The neighbors? I've been very neighborly!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I brought Mrs. Henderson a casserole last week.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: What was IN the casserole, Paul?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Protein! Very locally sourced.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: How local are we talking?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: You know Gerald, two doors down?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Exactly.

options.text: I don't want to know any more.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Pets? What pets?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The THIRTY missing pets, Paul. Thirty!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Animals are unpredictable, Carl.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Sometimes they run away. Sometimes they become part of something bigger.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Bigger like WHAT?!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Like the circle of life! Very Lion King.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The Lion King didn't involve casseroles!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Not the theatrical cut, no.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The trunk? Supplies!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Supplies that MOVE?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Active supplies. Very fresh.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul, is there something alive in our trunk?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Define 'alive.'

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: BREATHING. MOVING. CONSCIOUS.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Then... partially?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: We are going to the police.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh FUN! I love field trips!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Onward, then!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I think I see Mrs. Patterson waving from her window.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh wait, that's just the mannequin I left there.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The WHAT?!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: So she wouldn't get lonely! While she's away.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Where IS Mrs. Patterson, Paul?!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: On vacation! Very extended vacation.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: You two have some explaining to do.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: My garden has been RUINED.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I'm very sorry, Mrs. Henderson. Paul has been... experimenting.

options.text: Have you seen anything strange lately?

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: My prize-winning roses. DEAD. Overnight.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: And someone rearranged all my gnomes into a pentagram!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul said it was a summoning circle.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: A WHAT?!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: It's abstract art! Very avant-garde.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: And what's that SMELL coming from your apartment?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Potpourri!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: It's not potpourri.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: Strange? Where do I START?

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: Gerald hasn't been home in a week.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: Mrs. Patterson's lights are on but nobody answers the door.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: And SOMETHING keeps digging in everyone's yard at 3 AM.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Digging...

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: I set up a camera. But the footage just shows a shadow.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: A llama-shaped shadow.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Could be any llama!

options.text: I'm sorry, Mrs. Henderson. We'll sort this out.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: You'd better. I'm calling the neighborhood watch.

lines.speaker: mrs_henderson
lines.text: And tell your friend to stay OUT of my compost bin!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: But that's where I keep my--

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: PAUL. Shut up.

lines.speaker: neighbor_scared
lines.text: Oh god, it's YOU. The llamas from 42B.

lines.speaker: neighbor_scared
lines.text: Stay back! STAY BACK!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: We're not going to hurt you!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I brought cookies!

lines.speaker: neighbor_scared
lines.text: I am NOT eating anything you've made!

options.text: What's wrong? Why are you scared?

lines.speaker: neighbor_scared
lines.text: I SAW what your roommate did to Gerald's lawn.

lines.speaker: neighbor_scared
lines.text: And I don't mean the gnomes.

lines.speaker: neighbor_scared
lines.text: There were HOLES. And they were SHAPED WRONG.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Shaped wrong?

lines.speaker: neighbor_scared
lines.text: Like... person-shaped. But not quite.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Gardening! I was planting tulips!

lines.speaker: neighbor_scared
lines.text: TULIPS DON'T SCREAM AT MIDNIGHT!

lines.speaker: neighbor_scared
lines.text: Good. Leave. And don't come back.

lines.speaker: neighbor_scared
lines.text: I'm boarding up my windows tonight.

lines.speaker: neighbor_suspicious
lines.text: Hold it right there.

lines.speaker: neighbor_suspicious
lines.text: I've been keeping a log of every suspicious thing you two have done.

lines.speaker: neighbor_suspicious
lines.text: Three notebooks full.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Ooh, a fan!

lines.speaker: neighbor_suspicious
lines.text: October 5th: Large delivery at 2 AM. Crate-shaped. Moved by one llama.

lines.speaker: neighbor_suspicious
lines.text: October 12th: Garden hose borrowed. Returned with residue.

lines.speaker: neighbor_suspicious
lines.text: October 19th: Screaming from basement. Duration: 47 minutes.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Forty-seven minutes?!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I was watching a scary movie!

lines.speaker: neighbor_suspicious
lines.text: October 26th: Subject Paul seen carrying trash bags at 3 AM. Bags were MOVING.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Raccoons! I was relocating raccoons!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: To WHERE?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: A better place, Carl. A much better place.

lines.speaker: neighbor_suspicious
lines.text: This isn't over. I'm sending my notes to the authorities.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Good luck with that! The postman stopped coming last week.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: WHY did the postman stop coming, Paul?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Career change! Very sudden.

carl: The mailbox is dented. And damp.
Something is leaking from the mail slot.
paul: I love getting mail! Sending it too.
I sent all the neighbors something special this week.
horror: The mailbox drips steadily onto the pavement.
Flies circle the opening in a lazy spiral.

carl: Mrs. Henderson's garden gnome. It's facing our apartment.
Is that red paint on its hands? Please let it be paint.
paul: I named them all. This one guards the perimeter.
horror: The gnome's painted smile seems wider than before.
Its eyes follow you. That's not possible. But they do.

carl: An overturned trash can. The lid has claw marks on it.
From the inside.
paul: Waste management! Very important civic duty.
I've been helping the whole street with their garbage.
horror: A low buzzing emanates from within.

carl: The neighborhood fence. There's a gap where a board is missing.
Something pushed through here. Something big.
paul: But bad fences make it easier to visit them at night.

carl: Someone's parked car. The windows are fogged up from the inside.
I don't want to know why.
paul: Nice car! Reminds me of Gerald's.
Gerald won't be needing his anymore, of course.
horror: A handprint appears on the fogged window. From inside.

carl: A flower bed. The soil has been freshly turned.
At least I think it's soil. It's too dark to be soil.
paul: I planted these! Using only organic fertilizer.
horror: The flowers are growing impossibly fast.
They're the wrong color. Nothing in nature is that shade of red.

carl: The street lamp flickers on and off.
In the strobe-light effect, I swear I see shapes moving between the houses.
paul: Ambiance! I adjusted all the bulbs on this street.
Creates a lovely horror movie atmosphere, don't you think?

carl: A lawn sprinkler. The water coming out of it is definitely not clear.
It has a pinkish tint that makes my stomach turn.
paul: Hydration is important! For lawns AND people.
horror: The sprinkler pulses like a heartbeat.
The pink water pools in the gutter, thick and warm.

carl: I'm not going back to the apartment. Not after what I saw.
Forward. The car is ahead somewhere.
paul: Why would we go back? The fun is out here!

carl: The parking lot is the other way.
I need to stay focused.
Paul is still following me. I can't shake him.
Maybe that's for the best. At least I can keep an eye on him.
Something about this street doesn't feel right.
Where IS everybody?
paul: Isn't it peaceful? I love what I've done with the neighborhood.

carl: I can see the parking lot from here.
Almost there. Just a few more steps.
